entry.title: WCAG 2.2 final web standard expected in August 2023

link.title: WCAG 2.2 final web standard expected in August 2023

entry.content: WCAG 2.2 is now a W3C ‘Proposed Recommendation’. Proposed Recommendation means that W3C accepted it and W3C Members vote on publishing the document as a ‘W3C Recommendation’ web standard. The voting ends on 19 August. WCAG 2.2 might be ready to publish soon after that, or additional W3C Member input could require more work. To learn more and get up-to-date information, see What’s New in WCAG 2.2.

entry.title: WAI-ARIA 1.2 is a Web Standard “W3C Recommendation”

link.title: WAI-ARIA 1.2 is a Web Standard “W3C Recommendation”

entry.content: WAI-ARIA 1.2 is now a “W3C Recommendation” web standard. WAI-ARIA provides an ontology of roles, states, and properties that define accessible user interface elements. These semantics allow authors to convey user interface behaviors and structural information to assistive technologies. A list of what’s changed since WAI-ARIA 1.1 is in the changelog. For an introduction to WAI-ARIA and related resources, see the WAI-ARIA Overview.

entry.title: EPUB Standard for Accessible Digital Documents

link.title: EPUB Standard for Accessible Digital Documents

entry.content: EPUB 3.3 is now a “W3C Recommendation” web standard. EPUB defines a distribution and interchange format for digital publications and documents. Accessibility is an integral part of the EPUB standard. Today’s publications include: EPUB Accessibility 1.1. Learn more from the press release EPUB 3.3 becomes a W3C Recommendation.

entry.title: W3C WAI Updates for GAAD 2023
entry.content:
In preparation for Global Accessibility Awareness Day (GAAD), W3C WAI Updates for GAAD 2023 includes brief notes on:

  • WCAG 2.2 and WCAG 3
  • WAI resources
  • WAI leadership

We welcome your sharing this information widely.

entry.title: WCAG 2.1 in Ukrainian: Authorized Translation Published

link.title: WCAG 2.1 in Ukrainian: Authorized Translation Published

entry.content: Настанови з доступності вебвмісту (WCAG) 2.1, the Ukrainian Authorized Translation of Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1, is now available, following completion of the W3C Authorized Translations process. Other translations of WAI resources are listed in All WAI Translations. WAI encourages translations in all languages. If you might be interesting in translating resources, see Translating WAI Resources.

entry.title: Call for Implementations: WAI-Adapt: Symbols Module Candidate Recommendation

link.title: Call for Implementations: WAI-Adapt: Symbols Module Candidate Recommendation

entry.content: WAI-Adapt: Symbols Module is a technical specification that enables symbols to replace text in web content. It's now a W3C 'Candidate Recommendation'. That means we're seeking example implementations. To learn more, start with the e-mail announcement and the WAI-Adapt Overview.

entry.title: Invitation: AI and Accessibility Symposium, 10-11 January 2023, online

link.title: Invitation: AI and Accessibility Symposium, 10-11 January 2023, online

entry.content: You are invited to the Artificial Intelligence and Accessibility Research Symposium 10–11 January 2023. This online symposium brings together researchers, academics, industry, government, and people with disabilities to explore an aspect of emerging technology for accessibility: artificial intelligence (AI). Program, schedule, and registration information is in the meeting page. The symposium is free, and registration is required by 5 January 2023.
